ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Close examination of relevant topics in contemporary ethnomusicology of religion, with particular focus in ethnographies and case studies. Would highly recommend this course to students interested in ethnomusicology I wish more classes like this were offered for undergraduates in the music department!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course exposed me to musics and cultures that I had not yet encountered, while also broadening the ways that I thought about my own material. Because Professor Engelhardt was so open to students' ideas, my project allowed me to test out a lot of the issues I was having in my own work and see how class discussions might reshape my own thought processes. This course will, and has already, deeply contributed to my dissertation and research, and for that I am incredibly grateful. Professor Engelhardt allowed me to think in ways that I had not yet before, both more creatively and more openly, and this has had direct and immediate effects on my work. Thank you so very much.
